conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the right, above the objects.

The shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground to the right of their respective objects.

When a light source moves, shadows change in two primary ways: (1) Shadows move in the opposite direction of the light source, and (2) Shadows become shorter when the light is more directly above the objects.

conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left when the light source moves to the right.

premise: The light source becomes more directly above the objects, and shadows become shorter when the light is more directly above.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become shorter and smaller when the light source moves to the right.
